column2: Complete the sentences. Use I'll ... , won't ... or Will you ... .
column3:
A: Please don't go yet.
B: OK. {{c1::I'll stay|I will stay}} (I / stay) a little longer.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use I'll ... , won't ... or Will you ... .
column3:
A: Do you think you can win the race?
B: I don't know, but {{c1::I'll do|I will do}} (I / do) my best.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use I'll ... , won't ... or Will you ... .
column3:
A: I don't want anyone to know what happened.
B: It's OK. I {{c1::won't tell|will not tell}} (not / tell) anyone.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use I'll ... , won't ... or Will you ... .
column3:
A: I need a taxi to get to the station.
B: You don't need a taxi. {{c1::I'll take|I will take}} (I / take) you.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use I'll ... , won't ... or Will you ... .
column3:
A: {{c1::Will you wait}} (you / wait) for me?
B: Yes, but don't be too long.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use I'll ... , won't ... or Will you ... .
column3:
A: Paul isn't well, is he?
B: No, he {{c1::won't eat|will not eat}} (not / eat) anything.
